test_cases.name: Addition of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two positive integers using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 5 and 7 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two negative integers using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters -3 and -8 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of a positive and a negative integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition of a positive and a negative integer using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 10 and -4 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a positive integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition of zero and a positive integer using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 and 9 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a negative integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition of zero and a negative integer using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 and -7 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of large integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two large integers using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 1000000 and 2000000 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of minimum and maximum integer values
test_cases.description: Tests addition of Python's minimum and maximum integer values using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters -2147483648 and 2147483647 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of two zeros
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two zeros using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 and 0 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for first number
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when the first number is not an integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 'abc' as the first number and 5 as the second number.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for second number
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when the second number is not an integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 5 as the first number and 'xyz' as the second number.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for both numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when both numbers are not integers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 'foo' and 'bar' as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: No input provided for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user provides no input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, presses Enter without entering numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the missing input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Floating point input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters floating point numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 3.5 and 2.2 as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Special character input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters special characters as numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters '@' and '#' as the two numbers.
test_setup.when: Addition branch is executed.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Division of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Verifies correct division when both numbers are positive integers.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 10 as the first number and 2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division with negative dividend
test_cases.description: Checks division when the first number is negative.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters -10 as the first number and 2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division with negative divisor
test_cases.description: Checks division when the second number is negative.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 10 as the first number and -2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division with both numbers negative
test_cases.description: Checks division when both numbers are negative.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters -10 as the first number and -2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division by zero
test_cases.description: Checks the behavior when dividing by zero.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 10 as the first number and 0 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed or an exception is handled for division by zero.

test_cases.name: Division with zero numerator
test_cases.description: Checks division when the numerator is zero.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 0 as the first number and 5 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division with floating point numbers
test_cases.description: Checks division when both numbers are floating point values.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 7.5 as the first number and 2.5 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division with large numbers
test_cases.description: Checks division with very large numbers to test for overflow or precision issues.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 1e18 as the first number and 2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Division with very small numbers
test_cases.description: Checks division with very small numbers to test for underflow or precision issues.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 1e-10 as the first number and 2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Invalid operation choice
test_cases.description: Checks the behavior when the user enters an invalid operation choice.

test_setup.given: User enters an invalid operation choice (e.g., 9 or a non-numeric value).
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed or the user is prompted again.

test_cases.name: Non-numeric input for numbers
test_cases.description: Checks the behavior when the user enters a non-numeric value for one or both numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects division (option 4), enters 'abc' as the first number and 2 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed or the user is prompted again.

test_cases.name: Exit option
test_cases.description: Checks that the calculator exits when the user selects the exit option.

test_setup.given: User selects the exit option from the menu.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: The exit message is displayed and the loop terminates.

test_cases.name: Menu displayed on each iteration
test_cases.description: Checks that the operation menu is displayed on each iteration of the loop.

test_setup.given: User completes one operation and does not exit.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop continues.
test_setup.then: The operation menu is displayed again for the next operation.

test_cases.name: Addition of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two positive integers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 5 and 7 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of a negative and a positive integer
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds a negative and a positive integer.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters -3 and 8 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two negative integers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters -4 and -6 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a number
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds zero and another number.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 0 and 9 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of large numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two large numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 1000000 and 2000000 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of floating point numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two floating point numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 2.5 and 3.7 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of boundary values
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds the maximum and minimum representable float values.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters sys.float_info.max and -sys.float_info.max as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Invalid menu choice
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles an invalid menu choice gracefully.

test_setup.given: User enters 9 as the menu choice.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message or prompt to enter a valid choice is displayed.

test_cases.name: Non-numeric input for numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles non-numeric input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 'abc' and 5 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed and the user is prompted to enter a valid number.

test_cases.name: Exit the calculator loop
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator exits the loop when the user selects the exit option.

test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: The loop terminates and the program ends.

test_cases.name: Addition after performing other operations
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator can perform addition after other operations have been performed.

test_setup.given: User performs subtraction, multiplication, or division, then selects addition (choice 1) and enters 3 and 4.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Empty input for numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles empty input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters '' (empty string) for the first number and 2 for the second.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed and the user is prompted to enter a valid number.

test_cases.name: Non-numeric input for numerator
test_cases.description: Verify error handling when the numerator is not a number.

test_setup.when: Division branch is executed
test_setup.then: Error message is displayed indicating invalid input

test_cases.name: Non-numeric input for denominator
test_cases.description: Verify error handling when the denominator is not a number.

test_setup.when: Division branch is executed
test_setup.then: Error message is displayed indicating invalid input

test_cases.name: Division with minimum integer values
test_cases.description: Verify division works with minimum integer values.

test_setup.when: Division branch is executed

test_cases.name: Division with maximum integer values
test_cases.description: Verify division works with maximum integer values.

test_setup.when: Division branch is executed

test_cases.name: test_division_positive_integers
test_cases.description: Divides two positive integers and returns the correct quotient.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=10 and num2=2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_negative_dividend
test_cases.description: Divides a negative integer by a positive integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=-10 and num2=2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_negative_divisor
test_cases.description: Divides a positive integer by a negative integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=10 and num2=-2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_both_negative
test_cases.description: Divides two negative integers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=-10 and num2=-2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_zero_dividend
test_cases.description: Divides zero by a positive integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=0 and num2=5.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_float_result
test_cases.description: Divides two integers resulting in a non-integer (float) quotient.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=7 and num2=2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_by_zero
test_cases.description: Attempts to divide by zero, which should raise an error or handle gracefully.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=10 and num2=0.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.
test_setup.then: Division by zero error is raised or an error message is displayed.

test_cases.name: test_division_large_numbers
test_cases.description: Divides two large integers to test for overflow or precision issues.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=1000000000 and num2=2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_small_numbers
test_cases.description: Divides two small integers (including 1 and -1).

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1=1 and num2=-1.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_division_non_integer_input
test_cases.description: Handles non-integer input for either operand.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters num1='a' and num2=2.
test_setup.when: Division operation is performed.
test_setup.then: Input error is raised or an error message is displayed.

test_cases.name: test_division_menu_branch_only
test_cases.description: Ensures division is only performed when option 4 is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, 2, or 3, enters any numbers.
test_setup.when: Operation is performed.
test_setup.then: Division is not performed; no division output.

test_cases.name: Addition of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Verifies that the function correctly adds two positive integers when choice is 1.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters 5 and 7

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Checks addition of two negative numbers.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters -3 and -8

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and an integer
test_cases.description: Ensures adding zero to a number returns the number itself.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters 0 and 9

test_cases.name: Addition of large numbers
test_cases.description: Tests addition with large integer values to check for overflow or precision issues.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters 999999999 and 888888888

test_cases.name: Addition of negative and positive integer
test_cases.description: Checks addition where one number is negative and the other is positive.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters -10 and 15

test_cases.name: Addition of minimum and maximum integer values
test_cases.description: Tests addition with system's minimum and maximum integer values.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters -2147483648 and 2147483647

test_cases.name: Addition with float input
test_cases.description: Checks behavior when user enters a float instead of integer.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters 3.5 and 2
test_setup.then: Program raises ValueError or prompts for integer input

test_cases.name: Addition with non-numeric input
test_cases.description: Checks behavior when user enters a non-numeric value.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and enters 'a' and 2
test_setup.then: Program raises ValueError or prompts for valid integer input

test_cases.name: Addition with missing input
test_cases.description: Checks behavior when user provides no input for numbers.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and presses enter without input
test_setup.then: Program raises ValueError or prompts for input

test_cases.name: Menu loop continues after addition
test_cases.description: Ensures the menu is displayed again after performing addition.

test_setup.when: User selects addition and completes operation
test_setup.then: Menu is displayed again for next operation

test_cases.name: Exit after addition
test_cases.description: Checks that the program can exit after performing addition and then selecting exit.

test_setup.when: User performs addition, then selects exit
test_setup.then: Sum is printed, then exit message is displayed and loop breaks

test_cases.name: Invalid menu choice
test_cases.description: Checks behavior when user enters an invalid menu choice.

test_setup.when: User enters invalid menu choice
test_setup.then: No addition is performed, program may prompt for valid choice or continue loop

test_cases.name: Addition of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two positive integers using the Addition option.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two negative integers.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.

test_cases.name: Addition of a positive and a negative integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition where one number is positive and the other is negative.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a number
test_cases.description: Tests addition where one number is zero.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.

test_cases.name: Addition of large integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two large integers to check for overflow or precision issues.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.

test_cases.name: Addition of minimum and maximum integer values
test_cases.description: Tests addition of the minimum and maximum integer values supported.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters a non-integer value for one of the numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects Addition (1), enters 'abc' as the first number.
test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.
test_setup.then: Program raises ValueError or prints an error message indicating invalid input.

test_cases.name: Invalid menu choice
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters an invalid menu option.

test_setup.given: User enters 9 as the menu choice.
test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.
test_setup.then: Program does not perform any operation and may print an error or prompt again.

test_cases.name: Exit option
test_cases.description: Tests that the program exits when the user selects the Exit option.

test_setup.given: User selects Exit (5) as the menu choice.
test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.
test_setup.then: Program prints 'Exiting...' and terminates the loop.

test_cases.name: Blank input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user provides blank input for one of the numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects Addition (1), enters '' (blank) as the first number.
test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.
test_setup.then: Program raises ValueError or prints an error message indicating invalid input.

test_cases.name: Float input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters a float value instead of an integer.

test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.
test_setup.then: Program raises ValueError or prints an error message indicating invalid input.

test_cases.name: Multiple operations in sequence
test_cases.description: Tests that the loop continues and allows multiple operations until exit is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects Addition (1), enters 2 and 3, then selects Exit (5).
test_setup.when: main_loop is called and user inputs are provided.
